isis.stitle: VT 365 Diesel Engine - 2004 Model Year - CYLINDER HEAD AND VALVE TRAIN - Installation - Rocker Arm Carrier

figure.caption: Alignment guides and dowel sleeve bushing in 2004 and 2005 Model Year cylinder head (Eight tapped M8 holes)
Alignment guides and dowel sleeve bushing in 2005 Model Year cylinder head (Two tapped M8 holes)
Alignment guides and dowels in 2006 Model Year cylinder head (Two tapped M10 holes)

step1.para: Install dowel sleeve bushings in cylinder head.

note.para: Dowel sleeve bushings may still be attached to the cylinder head side of the rocker arm carrier.

step1.para: Install cylinder head and rocker carrier alignment guides (make locally), before installing rocker arm carrier.

Rotate the crankshaft until damper locating dowel hole is in the six o'clock position. This positions all pistons below TDC, so the valves do not contact the pistons when tightening the rocker arm assemblies.
Apply engine oil to the top center of each valve bridge.

figure.caption: 2004 and 2005 Model Year rocker arm carrier (Eight M8 clearance holes)
2006 Model Year rocker arm carrier (Two M10 clearance holes)
Installation of 2004 and 2005 Model Year rocker arm carrier (Eight M8 mounting bolts)
Installation of 2004 and 2005 Model Year rocker arm carrier (Two M8 mounting bolts)
Installation of 2006 Model Year rocker arm carrier (Two M10 mounting bolts)

step1.para: Place rocker arm carrier on guides.
Install M8 bolts and tighten to the standard torque .

item.para: Eight M8 x 50 bolts or two M8 x 50 bolts are required for 2004 and 2005 rocker arm carriers.
Two M10 x 50 bolts are required for 2006 rocker arm carriers.

note.para: If installing eight M8 x 50 bolts, pay close attention to rocker carrier alignment dowels when tightening down rocker arm carriers. It may be necessary to tighten the top four bolts first, then the lower bolts, to ensure correct engagement of dowels.

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, use only permanent ink markers to identify bolt torque orientation.
To prevent engine damage, check to make sure push rod has seated in the rocker arm pocket.

To prevent engine damage, install new M14 x 193 head bolts. Lightly lubricate new bolt threads and mating surfaces of bolt flanges with clean engine oil. Too much oil will cause hydrostatic lock and give incorrect torque reading.
Do not use anti-seize, grease, or any other lubricant except engine oil. Other lubricants have an adverse effect on torque results.

step1.para: Lightly lubricate 10 new M14 x 193 cylinder head bolts with clean engine oil.
Install the first eight bolts finger tight in the open positions.
Remove the two rocker arm carrier alignment guides and replace with the two remaining bolts finger tight.
